review.title: “Excellent opportunity to work and learn”
review.pros: Pros – CDOT is the best place to start one's career as it provides immense opportunities to learn while contributing to his/her job.
review.cons: Cons – Poor remuneration with respect to similar organizations in the private sector.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – C-DOT should come up with competetive remuneration to retain its workforce.

review.title: “Good Work For those who want to do it”

review.cons: Cons – Might subdued by your manager. Not a level playing field for everyone. Lot of discrimination depending upon your relations with upper management. Monotony can also arise.

review.title: “The experience at C-DoT has been largely disappointing”
review.pros: Pros – Stable and secure jobGood initial salaryIdeal for settling down, without much hassle
review.cons: Cons – Lethargic work environment in most groupsDisinterested/demotivated employeesFocus only on Govt. projects
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to focus on competitive products. Concentrate on specific areas, instead of doing whole product development. Welcome new projects from all customers and motivate employees.

review.title: “good for people who want to setlle in government but want to contribute to their field.”
review.pros: Pros – it is a central government owned company, so no feeling of job insecutity, but work is not as in govt org, its reserch oriented and you have to do a lot of work also.. homely culture with nice sport and event organisations.. not less salary enough to lead a good satisfactory life.. good place even for starters as you can learn lot of things on a complete basis..
review.cons: Cons – only two branches.(delhi and bangalore). salry growth cannot be compared tp private org.. the field of work is rather a declining field..
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – invest more money on wireless based 4g, LTE etc rather than supporting ur age old rax's and max's..

review.title: “My experiences at C-DOT as Student Trainee”
review.pros: Pros – For any CSE, ECE engineering undergrad at best institutions across india, C-DOT is like a dream come true, I may be overstating the fact, but ask their parents. Too good of a company to be Government owned, big campus, I mean real big; no hectic work schedule, nice compensations, no cubicles for research engineers and then there's the fact "I'm working for my country"
review.cons: Cons – Being govt. owned also counts as a con, fixed growth rate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please open research engineers job to IT grads to.

review.title: “Technical exposure is satisfactory”

review.title: “Satisfied, could be better”
review.pros: Pros – No compulsion to work extra hours. That would automatically mean we can leave office at time. So there will enough time to spend with family.The card level hardware design engineers have been given good design works.
review.cons: Cons – Pay hike is lesser compared to other companies in similar domains.No scope for on site work.In house entertainment activities are a minimum.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It could be better to have a flatter structure. There is a large gap between senior level managers and engineers. The information isn't passed down to bottom. Or lower level engineers are unaware of happenings at higher level.
